data.title: A Canticle for Leibowitz by Walter Miller, First Edition
data.meta_description: A Canticle for Leibowitz by Miller, Walter M and a great selection of related books, art and collectibles available now at AbeBooks.com.
data.text:
Hardcover. Condition: Fair. Dust Jacket Condition: Good. 1st Edition. Second printing of a classic. Given that, a heart breaker. The dust jacket is all there, but has a nasty library sticker on the spine that can't be removed without doing much damage. The dust jacket is I believe, matte paper. It is very easily damaged. Other than the sticker the dust jacket looks good. 4.95 price is on the flap. Second printing is stated on flap and copyright page. Text is solid, is worn on edge. has library stamps on front and back paste downs. After all this, still a good looking copy.

No Binding. 1st Edition Clamshell Collector's Case. (illustrator). 1st Edition Clamshell Collector's Case. No Binding. Custom Clamshell Case. No Binding. First Edition Clamshell Case. Superb Custom Fitted Modern Collector's Clamshell Bookcase [Not A Book] HAND-CRAFTED by our conservation team, each box is Gilt-stamped at the spine. The case is finished in rich black Nuba® with a 'sculpted design [after the book's distinct illustrated wrapper] on the side. Velour finished interior. Every TBCL case can be finished in a selection of fine leathers & cloths or Nuba® or a combination of both. Nuba® is a fine, supple & durable covering with a neutral ph that has the feel of velvety soft Italian Nubuck leather. This clamshell is perfectly sized to accommodate your first edition. A Handsome Collector's Custom Case for an important Book. Generally over 100 in-stock titles. Custom Craft available upon request. Book definitely NOT included. Photographs Upon Request.

Octavo, cloth-backed boards. First edition. 1961 Hugo award winner. "600 years after an atomic deluge the Age of Simplification reigns supreme, but a development to new civilization follows." - Gerber, Utopian Fantasy (1973), p. 160. "Named by many as best SF novel of the modern period." - Anatomy of Wonder (1987) 3-287. Anatomy of Wonder (1995) 3-125 and (2004) II-766. Pringle, Science Fiction: The 100 Best Novels 30. Survey of Science Fiction Literature I, pp. 288-93. Tiny tear in cloth along outer front joint, lower corner tips lightly rubbed, touch of tanning to page edges, a clean, very good copy. NO dust jacket. (#172816).

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good Plus. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 3rd Impression. Pretty nice copy of this classic dystopian novel. 1961 Hugo Award winner. Third impression stated on copyright page, 1960 shown on title page. Dark blue cloth with gold lettering to spine. Tight and square. Neat signature and address to front pastedown top but mostly hidden by front flap of jacket. Price intact jacket states second printing on front flap bottom. Jacket illlustration by George Sottung. Jacket has tiny nci at base of spine but bright and fresh. A classic. In mylar. Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall.

Pictorial boards. Condition: Very Good +. The uncommon 1968 1st Canadian edition of this classic of post-War science fiction. Solid and VG+ in its pictorial boards, with just a touch of very light soiling to the panels and a small, neat former owner inscription at the front free endpaper. Thick 12mo, 363 pgs. plus "Notes" and "Study Questions" at the rear.

First Edition (second impression). A CANTICLE FOR LEIBOWITZ, Lippincott, 1960, first edition (second impression with the book and dust-wrapper design of the first printing), upper fore edge corner tips ever so slightly bumped, else fine in what would have been a fine color pictorial dust-wrapper save for tanning to the dust-wrapper spine and both dust-wrapper covers. HUGO winning novel. Complments card from Thomas A. Burke of Lippincott laid in.

Hardcover. Condition: Near fine. Dust Jacket Condition: near fine. The second impression of A Canticle for Leibowitz, the Hugo Award winning novel from Walter M. Miller, Jr. (illustrator). First Edition, Second Impression. Octavo, 320pp. Purple boards, black cloth spine, title printed in purple on spine. Stated "second impression" on copyright page. Bookplate of Joseph P. Martino on front free endpaper. Touch of rubbing along bottom edge of front board, internally clean. In the publisher's second state dust jacket, $4.95 on front flap, with "second printing" stated on front flap, touch of toning to spine, bright illustrations, a near fine example. (Currey, 367). Walter M. Miller Jr. (1923-1996) was an American science fiction writer who served as a source of inspiration for Margaret Atwood's writings. The two have similar themes throughout their stories, including post-apocalyptic and dystopian societies, regressive/cyclical politics, and challenges between church and state. Miller won the 1961 Hugo Award for Best Novel for A Canticle for Leibowitz, a post-apocalyptic work of science fiction. This copy is from the library of Joseph P. Martino, a fellow science-fiction author and contributor of short stories to numerous magazines. He died in Sidney, Ohio in 2022.

Hard Cover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Condition: Very Good. First British. Authors only novel published in his lifetime, won the 1961 Hugo Award for Best Novel, the first of the novel Leibowitz series and considered one of the SF novels. CONDITION Burgundy bds with crisp silver title (unworn with tidy name inside front) 320 pages. Copy is bright and crisp. DJ has one short tear at front top near spine and slightest rubbing to ends and tips, not price clipped. Has been in a smokers house at some stage with discolouration the DJ, eps and edges. Size: 8vo - over 7¾" - 9¾" tall.

Hardcover. Condition: Good. 8.25 x 5.5", black cloth backed mauve pict boards, 320pp, covers lightly rubbed, spine ends bumped, extremities lightly worn, but front and back covers each have old brown cello tape perpendicular to the top and bottom edges, eps with uneven browning and old brown tape stains, EX-LIBRARY with circular ex-library stamp from Solano County Free Library on dedication page, and front fly has abrasion from library pocket removal; dustjacket is rubbed and darkened with a couple of spots, with old brown cello on rear flap. FIRST EDITION (so stated), in dustjacket with "$4.95" at bottom of front flap. Still, despite the problems listed above, a decent copy.

Hardcover. Condition: Very Good. Dust Jacket Included. 1st Edition. First UK edition. 8vo. Original burgundy boards. Dust-jacket, price-clipped. Famous post-apocalyptic sci-fi novel by American author Walter M. Miller Jr., first published in 1959. A Catholic monastery preserves the remnants of humanities scientific knowledge following a nuclear holocaust. Scarce. Bookseller's sticker to front pastedown; an excellent copy; jacket neatly price-clipped at inside front flap, a little frayed and chipped at head of spine and to lesser degree at foot of spine and fore-corners, overall very good.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First Edition, First Printing. This First Issue dustjacket has the publisher's $4.95 printed price present with minor wear to the spine. The book is bound in the publisher's cloth with minor wear to the boards. The pages are clean with NO writing, marks or bookplates in the book. A lovely copy.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. 1st Edition. First Edition, First Printing with the words "First Edition" printed on the copyright page. This ORIGINAL dustjacket has light wear to the edges. The book is in great shape. The binding is tight with NO cocking or leaning with minor wear to the boards. The pages are clean. There are 2 signatures from Dr Reback present. He was a Microbiologist involved in developing the sterile suit made for a young man that many of us remember as "The Boy in the Bubble". A lovely copy of this TRUE FIRST EDITION.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Near Fine. First Edition. ***** This is the true first edition, first printing (with "First Edition" stated on the copyright page, and with no later printings listed). ***** Very nice hardcover with dust jacket. There is NO writing, NO bookplates, and NO remainder marks. It is NOT a book club edition and NOT a former library book. The dust jacket is not price-clipped ($4.95). **** CONDITION: The book and the dust jacket are in NEAR FINE condition. ***** We include new mylar (clear) dust jacket protectors with all books at no extra charge. ***** OUR GUARANTEE TO YOU: All books are guaranteed to be as described. We believe that no sale is complete until you are happy. Any book is returnable for a full refund (including postage) if you're not 100% satisfied. Thank you! Richard Vick, Modern First Editions (Buying and Selling Modern First Editions since 1982).

Hardcover. Condition: Fine. Dust Jacket Condition: Fine. 1st Edition. First Edition, First Printing with the words "First Edition" printed on the copyright page. An attractive First Issue dustjacket that is vibrant in color with minor wear to the edges. This original dustjacket has the $4.95 price present on the front flap. The book is in excellent condition. The binding is tight and the boards are crisp with light wear to the edges. The pages are clean with NO writing, marks or bookplates in the book. A wonderful copy of this TRUE FIRST EDITION. We buy Walter Miller First Editions.

Hardcover. Condition: Near Fine +. 1st Edition. Signed & inscribed by Mr. Miller for me at his home in Florida ("Daytona Beach, Fla. 25 September 1984 for Larry Woods, with all best regards, Walter Miller,Jr."). Book is NF+, with scratch on back cover (one inch) and slightly faded strip on front cover (half inch by three inches).Very small printed sticker (about one inch square) on FFEP. DJ is NF-, has very slight wear at edges,two chips (quarter inch, eighth inch), one closed tear of half inch.DJ in mylar.Stated "First Edition". Selling my personal collection. Octavo, cloth-backed boards. First edition.First printing. 1961 Hugo award winner.bx 1100. No marks, no underlining, no bookplate.We package very carefully. Signed by Author(s).
